node.title: Florida releases math exercises they say teach critical race theory, Common Core
node.description: The Department said the textbooks had exercises based on critical race theory.

node.title: Greene testifies against challenge to her congressional candidacy
node.description: A group of constituents seeks to block Greene from the ballot in Georgia, based on a post-Civil War-era policy keeping insurrectionists out of office.

node.title: Father and son jailed for killing mother grizzly bear near Yellowstone
node.description: Officers visited the bear's den, discovering a dead cub that "perished as a result of the sow's failure to return."

node.title: Missing couple found shot to death in New Hampshire woods
node.description: Police have not said if this was a targeted attack or if they have suspect.

node.title: Ukraine aims to evacuate civilians from Mariupol as death toll mounts
node.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin accused Kyiv of refusing to allow its troops to surrender in Mariupol.

node.title: Covid-19 update: 7390 new community cases, 19 deaths, Omicron XE in NZ
node.description: There have been 7930 cases of Covid-19 reported today and 19 new deaths, including two under nine years old, as well as the first case of the Omicron XE variant in New Zealand.

node.title: Fisher edges Carrington for K1 500m national title
node.description: A superb display by reigning world champion Aimee Fisher has denied Dame Lisa Carrington another title at the national canoe sprint championships.

node.title: Could safe racing spots curb dirt-bikers on streets?
node.description: The lack of places to race safely could be one of the reasons dirt-bike street rides are happening in Auckland, a biker club president says.

node.title: But seriously - how the Queen keeps her sense of humour
node.description: There has been much solemnity and seriousness in the Queen's life - but as she reached her 96th birthday this week, what has often been overlooked is her sense of humour.

node.title: Elderly advocate 'disappointed' teen to be paroled for 90-year-old's death
node.description: Greypower's Horowhenua president is disappointed a teenager jailed for the manslaughter of Grace Virtue will be released on parole next month.

node.title: Madeleine McCann: Parents welcome declaration of formal suspect
node.description: Madeleine McCann's parents have welcomed news that a German man has been formally made a suspect over the three-year-old's disappearance.

node.title: Cost of living rises: Annual inflation hits 6.9 percent
node.description: The consumer price index rose 1.8 percent in the three months ended March driven by fuel, food, and housing costs.

node.title: Austin urges young players to 'ignore the haters'
node.description: Tracy Austin knows the pitfalls of being a teenage success story all too well after triumphing at the 1979 U.S. Open at just 16 but feels what she went through bears no comparison to the social media…

node.title: New Zealand Rugby appoint more women to board
node.description: Significant changes have been made to the New Zealand Rugby board, with the appointments of former Governor General Dame Patsy Reddy and Dunedin-based lawyer Rowena Davenport.

node.title: Patient may have had longest Covid-19 infection on record
node.description: UK doctors believe they have documented the longest Covid infection on record - a patient who had detectable levels of the virus for more than 16 months.

node.title: Anzac weekend road toll surpasses Easter weekend toll
node.description: Six people have so far died on New Zealand's roads this Anzac weekend, including four teenagers who were killed in a crash yesterday afternoon.

node.title: Meadows had been warned of possible Jan. 6 violence, official says
node.description: Cassidy Hutchinson told the committee "there were concerns brought forward" to Mark Meadows ahead of the riot.

node.title: Indigenous rights plan will likely undergo changes before public consultation - minister
node.description: The Māori Development minister anticipates a draft indigenous rights plan will likely undergo changes before it is released for public consultation.

node.title: Seven arrested, two in critical condition after Wellington gun incidents
node.description: Seven people have been arrested and a firearm recovered, after two people were critically injured in firearms-related incidents in Wellington this morning.

node.title: Tony Awards tell guests it has a no violence policy
node.description: The warning comes weeks after actor Will Smith slapped comedian Chris Rock onstage at the 2022 Oscars.

node.title: N.Y. attorney general says contempt order needed due to "Trump's intransigence"
node.description: Trump failed to meet a court-ordered March 31 deadline to turn over subpoenaed material.

node.title: Public welcome at many Anzac Day services under orange Covid setting
node.description: The Returned and Services Association says the public is welcome to attend the Anzac Day dawn service at Auckland Museum on Monday.

node.title: 'Full evacuation' of Mariupol called for as Russians take control
node.description: Russia pressed its new offensive in eastern Ukraine on Friday while in the port city of Mariupol, a full evacuation has been called for after Moscow declared victory there despite Ukrainian forces…

node.title: Northland hospitals full and short-staffed even before holiday influx to region
node.description: Northland hospitals are full and short-staffed, as the region expects more visitors and therefore more demand over the long weekend.

node.title: Captain tells crew to "stick together" after several Navy sailors died by suicide
node.description: Three sailors from the USS George Washington died by suicide within one week.

node.title: Person sets themself on fire in front of the Supreme Court
node.description: The court said there were no other injuries, and there does not appear to be a public safety concern.

node.title: Australian court fines Trivago $45m for misleading customers
node.description: The Federal Court found Trivago had breached Australian Consumer Law over a "lengthy period of time", and ordered the company to pay A$44.7 million in penalties.

node.title: Cantabrian World War II hero to be recognised with headstone rededication
node.description: A Cantabrian World War II hero well-known overseas is being recognised at home this Anzac Weekend.

node.title: High gas prices pump up demand for electric vehicles
node.description: One CEO warned this could be worse than the current chip shortage as demand for the materials inside the batteries skyrockets.

node.title: Man named as formal suspect in Madeleine McCann case
node.description: A man has been formally identified as a suspect in the disappearance of the British toddler 15 years ago, Portuguese prosecutors say.
